item.title: Converting to size units â€“ our solution and the winner
item.description: The task was to convert a number to the size units without using the built-in multipliers. Thank you all for taking the time to participate in this teaser.

item.title: Converting to size units (KB, MB,GB,TB, and PB) without using PowerShell multipliers
item.description: Hello everyone! After some time, here is the brand new brain teaser. We hope you will like the challenge. ðŸ™‚

item.title: Get the last modified date and time
item.description: Before we dive into this weekâ€™s teaser we would like to announce the winner of last weekâ€™s challenge. Ioan Corcodel, congratulations!

item.title: Output only the palindromic words
item.description: Hello everyone! The Brain Teaser series continues. First, we would like to announce the winner of the previous brain teaser. We got a number of very interesting and creative solutions.

item.title: Find a list of all IP addresses assigned to the local system
item.description: Hello everyone! The Brain Teaser series continues. First, we would like to announce the winner ofÂ the previous brain teaser. We got a few answers in which many of them have a command length of 8.

item.title: #PSTip A difference between the â€“replace operator and String.Replace method
item.description: The -replace operator takes a regular expression (regex) replacement rule as input and replaces every match with the replacement string. The operator itself is used as shown in the following schema: <input string> -replace <replacement rule>,<replacement string>

item.title: Assign a list of processes to a variable and output it to the console
item.description: Hello everyone! The Brain Teaser series continues. First, we need to announce the winner of the previous brain teaser. We got a lot of answers, but only three of them fulfilled all requirements ( the answers that use -split operator, the Split() method, or regex return the String objects, not System.

item.title: Convert a string to a character array
item.description: Hello everyone! We are back with a series of Brain Teasers. In the next 3 weeks we will publish one teaser per week.

item.title: Find an unused drive letter
item.description: Problem Your task is to write the shortest code to find one of the unused drive letters (excluding a,b and c).

item.title: Enumâ€™s numeric values
item.description: Problem Without any loop statements or pipelines, get the numeric values of an Enum (such as IO.FileAttributes) in 1 statement.

item.title: Private variable
item.description: Problem Attain the value of a private variable declared in a child scope from that scopeâ€™s own child scope.

item.title: Format elements
item.description: Problem Given an Array of at least 2 elements, return a new Array of formatted elements without using array indices, pipelines or loop statements.

item.title: Reverse text line
item.description: Problem Reverse a line of text without the use of Array’s Reverse method, Array indices, Array notation, pipelines or loop statements.
